trans-unit.source: To create a VNet by using the Azure portal, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To create a VNet by using the Azure portal, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Note that the screenshots are provided as examples.
trans-unit.target: Note that the screenshots are provided as examples.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to replace the values with your own.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to replace the values with your own.

trans-unit.source: For more information about working with virtual networks, see the [Virtual Network Overview](../articles/virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about working with virtual networks, see the [Virtual Network Overview](../articles/virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: From a browser, navigate to the [Azure portal](http://portal.azure.com) and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: From a browser, navigate to the [Azure portal](http://portal.azure.com) and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: Click **New** **>** **Networking** **>** **Virtual Network**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New** **>** **Networking** **>** **Virtual Network**.

trans-unit.source: VNetBlade
trans-unit.target: VNetBlade

trans-unit.source: Near the bottom of the Virtual Network blade, from the **Select a deployment model** list, select **Resource Manager**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Near the bottom of the Virtual Network blade, from the **Select a deployment model** list, select **Resource Manager**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Create virtual network** blade, configure the VNet settings.
trans-unit.target: On the **Create virtual network** blade, configure the VNet settings.

trans-unit.source: In this blade, you'll add your first address space and a single subnet address range.
trans-unit.target: In this blade, you'll add your first address space and a single subnet address range.

trans-unit.source: After you finish creating the VNet, you can go back and add additional subnets and address spaces.
trans-unit.target: After you finish creating the VNet, you can go back and add additional subnets and address spaces.

trans-unit.source: This is a current limitation of the portal.
trans-unit.target: This is a current limitation of the portal.

trans-unit.source: You can always come back to update these values by editing the VNet properties in the portal, or by using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You can always come back to update these values by editing the VNet properties in the portal, or by using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The values that you use will depend on the configuration you want to create.
trans-unit.target: The values that you use will depend on the configuration you want to create.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to refer to your planned configuration values.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to refer to your planned configuration values.

trans-unit.source: Create virtual network blade
trans-unit.target: Create virtual network blade

trans-unit.source: Verify that the **Subscription** is the correct one.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the **Subscription** is the correct one.

trans-unit.source: You can change subscriptions by using the dropdown.
trans-unit.target: You can change subscriptions by using the dropdown.

trans-unit.source: Click **Resource group** and either select an existing resource group, or create a new one by typing a name for your new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Click **Resource group** and either select an existing resource group, or create a new one by typing a name for your new resource group.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a new group, name the resource group according to your planned configuration values.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a new group, name the resource group according to your planned configuration values.

trans-unit.source: For more information about resource groups, visit [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md/#resource-groups).
trans-unit.target: For more information about resource groups, visit [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md/#resource-groups).

trans-unit.source: Next, select the **Location** settings for your VNet.
trans-unit.target: Next, select the **Location** settings for your VNet.

trans-unit.source: Note that the location will determine where the resources that you deploy to this VNet will reside.
trans-unit.target: Note that the location will determine where the resources that you deploy to this VNet will reside.

trans-unit.source: You can't change this later without redeploying your resources.
trans-unit.target: You can't change this later without redeploying your resources.

trans-unit.source: Select **Pin to dashboard** if you want to be able to find your VNet easily on the dashboard, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Pin to dashboard** if you want to be able to find your VNet easily on the dashboard, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Pin to dashboard
trans-unit.target: Pin to dashboard

trans-unit.source: After clicking Create, you will see a tile on your dashboard that will reflect the progress of your VNet.
trans-unit.target: After clicking Create, you will see a tile on your dashboard that will reflect the progress of your VNet.

trans-unit.source: The tile will change as the VNet is being created.
trans-unit.target: The tile will change as the VNet is being created.

trans-unit.source: Creating virtual network tile
trans-unit.target: Creating virtual network tile
